theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on durable cell cycle arrest, accumulation of senescent cells, and their SASP causing tissue dysfunction and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes sustained cell-cycle arrest, accumulation of senescent cells, SASP, and senotherapeutics targeting these cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cellular senescence causing premature aging phenotypes via accumulation and inflammation, highlighting senescence as causal.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cells as causal drivers of aging and senolytic interventions targeting senescent cell-specific antigens.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress-induced senescence, SASP, and accumulation of senescent cells driving aging and chronic disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes permanent growth arrest, antagonistic pleiotropy, accumulation of senescent cells, and therapeutic targeting of senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights senescence as causal driver with SASP promoting inflammaging and senolytic/senostatic therapies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details primary and secondary senescence, SASP propagation, and immune signaling in senescence spread and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on RNA binding proteins regulating senescence and linking molecular mechanisms to aging and diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cellular senescence acceleration and reduced cellular lifespan driving organismal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes accumulation of senescent cells, their role as aging drivers, and senotherapeutics as interventions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP-driven inflammation, senolytics/senostatics, and senescent cells causing resilience decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence and SASP in systemic aging and neurodegeneration, linking genetic risk factors to senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation and senolytic drugs alleviating age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates cellular senescence with immunosenescence and gut microbiota dysbiosis as interconnected aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes dual role of senescent cells, SASP effects, and senescence as biomarker and causal factor in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links senescent cell accumulation and SASP to neurodegeneration and Parkinson’s disease pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence driving vascular calcification via SASP and molecular pathways affecting vascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence and SASP as aging drivers and pharmacological modulation of senescence pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence, SASP, and senolytic/senomorphic therapies in HIV and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescent Cell Accumulation and SASP-Driven Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Summarizes aging as resulting from senescent cell accumulation and their pro-inflammatory secretions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR and Autophagy Regulation in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mTOR signaling regulating senescence phenotypes and its interplay with autophagy affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: mTOR and Autophagy Regulation in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related decline in autophagy, transcriptional regulation by TFEB/FOXOs, and therapeutic targeting.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Mitophagy Impairment in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial dysfunction, impaired mitophagy, and ROS production as key drivers of senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Mitophagy Impairment in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links cellular senescence with impaired autophagy, metabolic imbalance, and oxidative stress driving organ aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Reprogramming and Cellular Senescence Reversal Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic clock resetting via iPSC reprogramming to reverse senescence, mitochondrial dysfunction, and aging hallmarks.
